snippet: Two Texas sisters, ages 12 and 10, run in some of the most grueling races in the nation, but doctors say they are not in danger despite how young they are.
abstract: Runners Kaytlynn and Heather Welsch, Texas sisters aged 10 and 12, are participating alongside elite athletes in some of the most grueling races in the nation; critics have voiced concerns about the girls' safety, but doctors maintain that they are not in danger despite their young age.
lead_paragraph: Two Texas sisters, ages 12 and 10, run in some of the most grueling races in the nation, but doctors say they are not in danger despite how young they are.

headline.seo: Too Fast, Too Soon? Young Endurance Runners Draw Cheers and Concerns
headline.main: Young Endurance Runners Draw Cheers and Concerns
